dict.string: Similar to nmap, scan a range of ports on a host.

Prevent Mac from falling asleep for an hour.
Change default shell to zsh.

Bash redirect stdin and stderror to /dev/null.

Use brackets to copy a file, making several backups, renaming in place.

Get the version no. of an app.
Change the SUS server, i.e. for use with Reposado.
Disable cmd-tab inside a Screen Sharing session.
Keep from writing .DS_Store files to file servers.

dict.string: Enable text selection in QuickLook.
Display diff in split screen.
Return your external facing IP address.
Reset the DNS cache (10.10) (Multicast).
Reset the DNS cache (10.10) (Unicast).
Return the current boot drive.

dict.string: Check the OS version of the current recovery partition.
Discover Macs on the network; run for 30 seconds and cancel to print results.
Get IP of a host
Get lookup info on user 'foo'.
Print filesystem usage in human readable format, with a depth of one directory.
Delete .DS_Store files.
dict.key: find . -type f 2>/dev/null | while read A; do md5 -q $A 2>/dev/null; done | uniq -d
dict.string: Check for duplicate files in the current directory.
Show App Store apps.
search directory foo for files named bar and delete them.
dict.key: for i in ~/.ssh/*.pub; do ssh-keygen -l -f "$i"; done
dict.string: Check ssh key finderprint
f the commit you want to squash into is the last commit, you can even directly add new changes to it by using the --amend flag when committing
Finding which files differ (instead of what differs inside files).
Diff by highlighting inline word changes instead of whole lines.
Compress and clean up the repo.
Search commit logs.
Show branches and tags in a simple git log.
Print out a readable git log.
Squash the last two commits into one, useful for fixing silly errors.
Un-stages files staged for commits ONLY, so all your changes are still there.
Cear all un-committed changes and revert back all your files to the state reflected by your last commit. DESTRUCTIVE.
Delete a commit forever and ever.
Shows the last merge commit.
Show the last commit with the string 'fix'.
Show short status output in git.
See what is running on a port, for example, port 69
Mount a damaged disk image, to attempt to recover data.
Mount dmg hidden from view.
Create a new disk image.
dict.key: history | awk '{print $2}' | awk 'BEGIN{FS="|"}{print $1}' | sort | uniq -c | sort -n | tail -n 20 | sort -nr
dict.string: Return a sorted list of your most used commands.
Display the showChoicesXML information for a given package.
Get serial number of current Mac.
Get IP address for en0.
Get the DNS server for en0.
Get subnet mask for en0.
Get DHCP information for en0.
Create a symlink.
Count the number of files in the current working directory, for example PDF files.
Count the number of regular files in the current working directory.
Count the number of directories in the current working directory.
Use brackets to list files in four different directories in the same tree.
Print the bill of materials for a package.
Display a list of all of the applications which have connected to the Internet.

Make multiple directories in one go.
Create a temporary directory.
Mount SMB share using domain credentials.
See open ARD connections.
Show network route table.

Verify the SHA1 digest of a downloaded file, such as an update from Apple support.

See processes by a specific app, for example Chrome.

Use an ssh tunnel.

Reset the DNS cache (10.6).

dict.string: List files as they are being opened.

dict.string: List files as they are being written to disk.
List network related events.
Watch Finder activity.
Part of dtrace, presents a top-like listing. On a sluggish machine, one could track the drive activity to determine what was slowing a system down.
Reset the DNS cache (10.7+).
Force spotlight index to be rebuilt.
Turn on verbose boot
Boot into Safe Mode and Verbose Mode simultaneously.
Watch a file.

Watch a process.
Max out the volume using applescript.
Kill specific process by name 'Foo'.
Disable safe sleep mode. If you want safe sleep mode back, just change the '0' to a '3'.
Part of dtrace, observes read and writes at the application level. Very verbose, and hooked into the kernel, so very accurate.

Set the localhost and sharing name.
